english_translation: Narrated by Mujahid: Regarding the saying of Allah 'Whoever is forgiven something from his brother' (Surah Al-Baqarah 2:178), he said: It is forgiveness of blood and accepting of blood money. Then he said: 'Whoever transgresses after that' (Surah Al-Baqarah 2:178), meaning after accepting the blood money, 'then for him is a painful punishment' (Surah Al-Baqarah 2:178).

english_translation: Narrated by Mujahid: Regarding the saying of Allah 'Whoever fears from a testator injustice or a sin' (Surah Al-Baqarah 2:182), meaning: distortion or sin. If he exaggerated they ordered him to justice, and if he fell short from a right, they said to him: Do this, give this, give so-and-so this.

english_translation: Narrated from Ibn Abbas regarding the saying of Allah 'And upon those who are able to do it' (Surah Al-Baqarah 2:184), he said: Those who strain themselves and are not able to do it, food of a poor person. Then whosoever volunteers good, it is better for him, and to fast is better for you if you know, and that it is not abrogated. Ibn Abbas said: And permission in this verse is not given except for the very old man who cannot fast, and the patient one who it is known he will not be cured.

english_translation: Narrated by Mujahid: He said: They used to fast, so when night came they would eat, drink, and have intercourse. If one of them slept, that became forbidden for him until the same time the next night. Some of them used to deceive themselves in that, so Allah made it easy for them and made lawful for them food, drink, and intercourse before sleep and after it during the entire night.

english_translation: Narrated by Mujahid: Regarding the saying of Allah 'Until there is no persecution' (Surah Al-Baqarah 2:193), he said: There is no idolatry, and 'And the religion should be for Allah only. So if they cease' (Surah Al-Baqarah 2:193), he said: Do not fight except those who fight you. Then from Abd al-Rahman: I narrated that Ibrahim said: I heard Adam say: I heard Warqa say: From Ibn Abi Najjah from Mujahid saying: 'Quraysh boasted about repelling the Messenger of Allah ﷺ while in sacred state at Hudaybiyyah away from the Sacred House in Dhu al-Qi'dah, so Allah brought him into Makkah the following year in Dhu al-Qi'dah, and he completed his Umrah - he completed it at the day of Hudaybiyyah - so Allah said: The sacred month for the sacred month, and sacred things are retaliatory (Surah Al-Baqarah 2:194)'.
